description: Integers n < (reversal of n) such that (reversal of n) + 1 is divisible by n-1.
example: For n = 12, the reversal of n is 21, 12-1 = 11, 21+1 = 22 and 11 divides 22.
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = {d = digits(n); revn = sum(i = 1, #d, d[i]*10^(i - 1)); (revn > n) && (n!=1) && ((revn + 1) % (n - 1) == 0);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 22 2013
author: Mary L. Sellers (sellersm(AT)cedarville.edu), Jan 22 2000
